articles.title: What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built
articles.description: What languages are growing fastest, and why? What about the projects that people are interested in the most? Where are new developers cutting their teeth? Let’s take a look at Octoverse data to find out. The post What the fastest-growing tools reveal about how software is being built appeared first
articles.content: In 2025, software development crossed a quiet threshold. In our latest Octoverse report , we found that the fastest-growing languages, tools, and open source projects on GitHub are no longer about shipping more code. Instead, they’re about reducing friction in a world where AI is helping developers build more, faster. By looking at some of the areas of fastest growth over the past year, we can see how developers are adapting through: The programming languages that are growing most in AI-as
articles.author: Dylan Birtolo

articles.title: The best VR headsets for 2026
articles.description: Stepping into VR is about more than strapping on a headset and loading a game. The best VR headsets today are gateways to fully realized experiences, whether that’s gaming, fitness, creative work or simply spending time inside a richly rendered virtual world. As the hardware has improved, so has the
articles.content: Stepping into VR is about more than strapping on a headset and loading a game. The best VR headsets today are gateways to fully realized experiences, whether that’s gaming, fitness, creative work or simply spending time inside a richly rendered virtual world. As the hardware has improved, so has the sense of presence, with sharper displays, wider fields of view and tracking systems that make movement feel more natural and responsive. The result is VR that feels less like a novelty and more like
articles.author: Devindra Hardawar

articles.title: Why we stopped stitching SQL + vector databases for AI apps - Answer is sochDB
articles.description: Building a Local RAG + Memory System with an Embedded Database When building RAG or agent-style AI applications, we often end up with the same stack: SQL for structured data a vector database for embeddings custom glue code to assemble context extra logic to track memory This works — but it quickly
articles.content: Building a Local RAG + Memory System with an Embedded Database When building RAG or agent-style AI applications, we often end up with the same stack: SQL for structured data a vector database for embeddings custom glue code to assemble context extra logic to track memory This works — but it quickly becomes hard to reason about, especially in local-first setups. In this post, I’ll walk through a real, minimal example of building a local RAG + memory system using a single embedded database, based
articles.author: bhaskararao arani

articles.title: Exploring the Future of SEO: Insights into AEO and GEO
articles.description: TL;DR: Google isn't the only search engine anymore. I optimized indx.sh for traditional search (SEO), answer engines like featured snippets (AEO), and AI assistants like ChatGPT and Claude (GEO). Here's what I learned. The Discovery Problem in 2026 When I launched indx.sh, I assumed SEO was the whol
articles.content: TL;DR: Google isn't the only search engine anymore. I optimized indx.sh for traditional search (SEO), answer engines like featured snippets (AEO), and AI assistants like ChatGPT and Claude (GEO). Here's what I learned. The Discovery Problem in 2026 When I launched indx.sh, I assumed SEO was the whole game. Rank on Google, get traffic, done. Then I noticed something: developers were finding tools through ChatGPT. They'd ask "what's a good MCP server for PostgreSQL?" and get answers. No Google inv

articles.title: Nvidia's $100 billion OpenAI deal has seemingly vanished
articles.description: Two AI giants shake market confidence after investment fails to materialize.
articles.content: In September 2025, Nvidia and OpenAI announced a letter of intent for Nvidia to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI's AI infrastructure. At the time, the companies said they expected to finalize details "in the coming weeks." Five months later, no deal has closed, Nvidia's CEO now says the $100 billion figure was "never a commitment," and Reuters reports that OpenAI has been quietly seeking alternatives to Nvidia chips since last year. Reuters also wrote that OpenAI is unsatisfied with the speed
articles.author: Benj Edwards

Valve is on track to start shipping its AMD-powered Steam Machine early this year, she said, while Microsoft’s development of an Xbox with a
articles.content: Microsoft could launch the next-generation Xbox console sometime in 2027, AMD CEO Lisa Su has revealed during the semiconductor company’s latest earnings call. Valve is on track to start shipping its AMD-powered Steam Machine early this year, she said, while Microsoft’s development of an Xbox with a semi-custom SOC from AMD is “progressing well to support a launch in 2027.” While it doesn’t necessarily mean Microsoft is releasing a new Xbox console next year, that seems to be the company’s curre
articles.author: Mariella Moon

articles.title: Netflix says users can cancel service if HBO Max merger makes it too expensive
articles.description: 80 percent of HBO Max subscribers subscribe to Netflix, Sarandos tells Senate.
articles.content: There is concern that subscribers might be negatively affected if Netflix acquires Warner Bros. Discovery’s (WBD's) streaming and movie studios businesses. One of the biggest fears is that the merger would lead to higher prices due to Netflix having less competition. During a Senate hearing today, Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos suggested that the merger would have an opposite effect. Sarandos was speaking at a hearing held by the US Senate Judiciary Committee’s Subcommittee on Antitrust, Competitio
articles.author: Scharon Harding

articles.title: How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities
articles.description: A senior engineer's guide to architecting and extending Copilot's real-world applications. The post How to maximize GitHub Copilot’s agentic capabilities appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: Modern engineering work rarely lives in a single file. Real systems evolve across years of incrementally layered decisions—some good, some accidental. A single feature request (“Add tagging to notes,” “Refactor the validation layer,” “Support a new consumer on our API”) often touches controllers, domain models, repositories, migrations, tests, documentation, and deployment strategy. Copilot’s agentic capabilities don’t replace your judgment i
articles.author: Ari LiVigni

articles.content: On Tuesday, the Department of Justice and the plaintiffs in the antitrust case against Google filed a cross-appeal , as the DOJ Antitrust Division announced in a post on X : "Today, the DOJ Antitrust Division filed notice that it will cross-appeal from the remedies decisions in its case against Google's unlawful monopolization of internet search and search advertising." Just a few weeks ago, Google itself filed a notice to appeal and requested a pause on the remedies ordered by DC District Court

articles.content: One of the toughest parts of any new computer build or upgrade is finding the right video card. In a gaming PC, the GPU is easily the most important part, and you can limit your experience by going with the wrong model. It's all about the games The first question to ask yourself is what kind of

articles.title: Microbes could extract the metal needed for cleantech
articles.description: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this
articles.content: In a pine forest on Michigan’s Upper Peninsula, the only active nickel mine in the US is nearing the end of its life. At a time when carmakers want the metal for electric-vehicle batteries, nickel concentration at Eagle Mine is falling and could soon drop too low to warrant digging. But earlier this year, the mine’s owner started testing a new process that could eke out a bit more nickel. In a pair of shipping containers recently installed at the mine’s mill, a fermentation-derived broth develop

articles.title: What we’ve been getting wrong about AI’s truth crisis
articles.description: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here. What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the
articles.content: This story originally appeared in The Algorithm, our weekly newsletter on AI. To get stories like this in your inbox first, sign up here . What would it take to convince you that the era of truth decay we were long warned about—where AI content dupes us, shapes our beliefs even when we catch the lie, and erodes societal trust in the process—is now here? A story I published last week pushed me over the edge. It also made me realize that the tools we were sold as a cure for this crisis are failing
articles.author: James O'Donnell

articles.title: Adobe actually won’t discontinue Animate
articles.description: Adobe is no longer planning to discontinue Adobe Animate on March 1st. In an FAQ, the company now says that Animate will now be in maintenance mode and that it has "no plans to discontinue or remove access" to the app. Animate will still receive "ongoing security and bug fixes" and will still
articles.content: Adobe is no longer planning to discontinue Adobe Animate on March 1st. In an FAQ, the company now says that Animate will now be in maintenance mode and that it has "no plans to discontinue or remove access" to the app. Animate will still receive "ongoing security and bug fixes" and will still be available for "both new and existing users," but it won't get new features. Many creators expressed frustration after Adobe's original discontinuation announcement from Monday ( here's a Wayback Ma
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: Godlike Titan threatens humanity in Monarch: Legacy of Monsters S2 trailer
articles.description: "This Titan is like a god, and the sea creatures worship it."
articles.content: Last month, Apple TV released a teaser for the second season of Monarch: Legacy of Monsters , part of Legendary Entertainment’s MonsterVerse , which brought Godzilla, King Kong, and various other monsters ( kaiju ) created by Toho Co., Ltd into a shared narrative. But we only got the most fleeting glimpse of the promised new mythical Titan threatening the human race. The full trailer just dropped and rectifies that: it's a gigantic tentacled undersea being dubbed Titan X—and only Kong and Godzil
articles.author: Jennifer Ouellette

articles.title: DOJ and states appeal Google monopoly ruling to push for harsher penalties against the company

Today, the US Department of Justice filed notice of a plan to cross-appeal the decision last fall that Google would not be req
articles.content: Google might have been officially ruled to have a monopoly, but we're still a long way from figuring out exactly what that determination will change at the tech company. Today, the US Department of Justice filed notice of a plan to cross-appeal the decision last fall that Google would not be required to sell off the its Chrome browser. The agency's Antitrust Division posted about the action on X. According to Bloomberg , a group of states is also joining the appeal filing. At the time of
articles.author: Anna Washenko

articles.description: Microsoft confirmed last year that it's working on a next-gen Xbox console in partnership with AMD. Now, AMD is hinting that the next Xbox console, which will use custom AMD chips, could be launching in 2027. "Development of Microsoft's next-gen Xbox, featuring an AMD semi-custom SoC, is progressing
articles.content: Microsoft confirmed last year that it's working on a next-gen Xbox console in partnership with AMD . Now, AMD is hinting that the next Xbox console, which will use custom AMD chips, could be launching in 2027. "Development of Microsoft's next-gen Xbox, featuring an AMD semi-custom SoC, is progressing well to support a launch in 2027," said AMD CEO Lisa Su on an earnings call today. The brief comment doesn't confirm Microsoft will launch a new Xbox in 2027, but it does reveal that AMD is ready to
articles.author: Tom Warren

articles.title: Newborn dies after mother drinks raw milk during pregnancy
articles.description: Raw milk is promoted by anti-vaccine Health Secretary Kennedy.
articles.content: A newborn baby has died in New Mexico from a Listeria infection that state health officials say was likely contracted from raw (unpasteurized) milk that the baby's mother drank during pregnancy. In a news release Tuesday , officials warned people not to consume any raw dairy, highlighting that it can be teeming with a variety of pathogens. Those germs are especially dangerous to pregnant women, as well as young children, the elderly, and people with weakened immune systems. "Raw milk can contain
articles.author: Beth Mole
